verses.verse: Woe <WH480> is me<WH625>! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits<WH7019>, as the grape gleanings<WH5955> of the vintage<WH1210>: there is no cluster<WH811> to eat<WH398>; my soul<WH5315> desireth<WH183> the first-ripe<WH1063> fig.

The godly<WH2623> man is perished<WH6> out of the earth<WH776>, and there is none upright<WH3477> among men<WH120>: they all lie in wait<WH693> for blood<WH1818>; they hunt<WH6679> every man<WH376> his brother<WH251> with a net<WH2764>.

Their hands<WH3709> are upon that which is evil<WH7451> to do it diligently<WH3190>; the prince<WH8269> asketh<WH7592>, and the judge<WH8199> is ready for a reward<WH7966>; and the great<WH1419> man<WH1696>, he uttereth the evil<WH1942> desire<WH5315> of his soul<WH5686>: thus they weave it together.

The best<WH2896> of them is as a brier<WH2312>; the most upright<WH3477> is worse than a thorn hedge<WH4534>: the day<WH3117> of thy watchmen<WH6822>, even thy visitation<WH6486>, is come<WH935>; now shall be their perplexity<WH3998>.
Trust <WH539> ye not in a neighbor<WH7453>; put ye not confidence<WH982> in a friend<WH441>; keep<WH8104> the doors<WH6607> of thy mouth<WH6310> from her that lieth<WH7901> in thy bosom<WH2436>.

For the son<WH1121> dishonoreth<WH5034> the father<WH1>, the daughter<WH1323> riseth up<WH6965> against her mother<WH517>, the daughter-in<WH2545>-law against her mother-in<WH3618>-law; a man<WH376>'s enemies<WH341> are the men<WH582> of his own house<WH1004>.
But as for me<WH6822>, I will look unto Jehovah<WH3068>; I will wait<WH3176> for the God<WH430> of my salvation<WH3468>: my God<WH430> will hear me<WH8085>.
Rejoice <WH8055> not against me<WH341>, O mine enemy: when I fall<WH5307>, I shall arise<WH6965>; when I sit<WH3427> in darkness<WH2822>, Jehovah<WH3068> will be a light unto me<WH216>.

I will bear<WH5375> the indignation<WH2197> of Jehovah<WH3068>, because I have sinned<WH2398> against him<WH7378>, until he plead my cause<WH7379>, and execute<WH6213> judgment<WH4941> for me<WH3318>: he will bring me forth to the light<WH216>, and I shall behold<WH7200> his righteousness<WH6666>.

Then mine enemy<WH341> shall see<WH7200> it<WH955>, and shame shall cover<WH3680> her who said<WH559> unto me<WH3068>, Where is Jehovah thy God<WH430>? Mine eyes<WH5869> shall see<WH7200> my desire upon her<WH4823>; now shall she be trodden down as the mire<WH2916> of the streets<WH2351>.
A day<WH3117> for building<WH1129> thy walls<WH1447>! in that day<WH3117> shall the decree<WH2706> be far removed<WH7368>.

In that day<WH3117> shall they come<WH935> unto thee from Assyria<WH804> and the cities<WH5892> of Egypt<WH4693>, and from Egypt<WH4693> even to the River<WH5104>, and from sea<WH3220> to sea<WH3220>, and from mountain<WH2022> to mountain<WH2022>.
Yet shall the land<WH776> be desolate<WH8077> because of them that dwell<WH3427> therein<WH6529>, for the fruit of their doings<WH4611>.

Feed <WH7462> thy people<WH5971> with thy rod<WH7626>, the flock<WH6629> of thy heritage<WH5159>, which dwell<WH7931> solitarily<WH910>, in the forest<WH3293> in the midst<WH8432> of Carmel<WH3760>: let them feed<WH7462> in Bashan<WH1316> and Gilead<WH1568>, as in the days<WH3117> of old<WH5769>.
As in the days<WH3117> of thy coming<WH3318> forth out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> will I show<WH7200> unto them marvellous things<WH6381>.
The nations<WH1471> shall see<WH7200> and be ashamed<WH954> of all their might<WH1369>; they shall lay<WH7760> their hand<WH3027> upon their mouth<WH6310>; their ears<WH241> shall be deaf<WH2790>.

They shall lick<WH3897> the dust<WH6083> like a serpent<WH5175>; like crawling things<WH2119> of the earth<WH776> they shall come trembling<WH7264> out of their close places<WH4526>; they shall come with fear<WH3372> unto Jehovah<WH3068> our God<WH430>, and shall be afraid because of thee<WH3372>.

Who is a God<WH410> like unto thee<WH5375>, that pardoneth iniquity<WH5771>, and passeth over<WH5674> the transgression<WH6588> of the remnant<WH7611> of his heritage<WH5159>? he retaineth<WH2388> not his anger<WH639> for ever<WH5703>, because he delighteth<WH2654> in lovingkindness<WH2617>.

He will again<WH7725> have compassion<WH7355> upon us<WH3533>; he will tread our iniquities<WH5771> under foot<WH7993>; and thou wilt cast all their sins<WH2403> into the depths<WH4688> of the sea<WH3220>.
Thou wilt perform<WH5414> the truth<WH571> to Jacob<WH3290>, and the lovingkindness<WH2617> to Abraham<WH85>, which thou hast sworn<WH7650> unto our fathers<WH1> from the days<WH3117> of old<WH6924>.
